alert.note: Alert for Polk; San Jacinto; Trinity; Walker (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 2:08PM CST until January 29 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Trinity River at Riverside affecting Polk, San Jacinto, Walker and Trinity Counties. Trinity River near Goodrich affecting Polk, Liberty and San Jacinto Counties. Long King Creek near Livingston affecting Polk and San Jacinto Counties. Caney Creek near Splendora affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. West Fork San Jacinto near Humble affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. Lake Creek at Sendera Ranch Road affecting Montgomery County. San Bernard River near Sweeny affecting Brazoria County. San Bernard River near Boling affecting Wharton, Fort Bend and Brazoria Counties. Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Menard Creek near Rye affecting Liberty, Hardin and Polk Counties. Peach Creek at Splendora affecting Harris and Montgomery Counties. Colorado River at Columbus affecting Wharton and Colorado Counties. For the Trinity River...including Crockett, Riverside, Romayor, Goodrich, Liberty, Moss Bluff...Major flooding is forecast. For the Long King Creek...including Livingston...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Peach Creek...including Splendora...Minor flooding is forecast. For the West Fork San Jacinto River...including Porter, Sendera Ranch Road, Conroe, Humble, Sheldon...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Trinity River at Riverside. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 135.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding continues as significant backwater up Thomas Lake floods the lowest areas in the Green Rich Shore Subdivision in Walker County with the boat ramp completely inundated. The lowest lying areas in the Deep River Plantation Subdivision and FM 980 northwest of Riverside are threatened. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 135.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 133.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 PM CST Wednesday was 135.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Monday morning and continue falling to 133.3 feet early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 133.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 135.4 feet on 03/12/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Trinity River Riverside 133.5 135.4 Wed 1 pm CST 135.3 135.3 135.1 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued tonight.Thursday morning at 815 AM CST.
